title: Mark301
author: Mark301
content: Cryptocurrency is currently collapsing. And the total crypto market cap is now less than $1 trillion.The market is red, and every cryptocurrency is crashing. Is it better to wait for a further drop in Bitcoin and Ethereum, or would DCA be better?What will happen next?How long do you think the market will take to recover?

comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: Quote from: Mark301 on June 14, 2022, 06:54:21 AMThe market is red, and every cryptocurrency is crashing. Is it better to wait for a further drop in Bitcoin and Ethereum, or would DCA be better?DCA is usually the best way for Bitcoin. For ETH I cannot tell; ETH may go south badly if it (ever) goes PoS, but you better ask in altcoin area...Quote from: Mark301 on June 14, 2022, 06:54:21 AMWhat will happen next?Sorry, my crystal ball was malfunctioning and I've sent it out for technical inspection, I can't help with this.Quote from: Mark301 on June 14, 2022, 06:54:21 AMHow long do you think the market will take to recover?As I said a few days ago:Quote from: NeuroticFish on June 09, 2022, 06:42:26 PMA rough calculation tells that at around 1.5 years after halving there's the ATH and the downtrend starts, after one more year (more or less) it's basically in the crypto winter and from that point we're getting slowly back to bullish trend, and in 1.5 years there's halving again.So if you do the math in Q4 we should be back on (slow) up trend. Of course, this may or may not happen. Or may happen earlier. Or later. (Sorry, I know it's not helpful, but I don't want to lie to you.)

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: I wish it would drop further more. There's still sooo much overpriced trash everywhere that we need a bigger wipeout of most of the trashy altcoins. Blockchain based games in the billions but yet has little to no players, like what. We need to nuke 'em all.

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: Quote from: Mark301 on June 14, 2022, 06:54:21 AMHow long do you think the market will take to recover?It will recover so long after people have given up on the currently meaningless over inflated shitcoins, Defis and NFTs just like it was with the scam ICO's in 2018-2019 crypto winter. After that the cycle will start over again with a new scam type of hype.If you have bought one of those shitcoins, my advice is buckle up, the bumpy ride is just getting started.

comments.author: tvplus006
comments.body: Quote from: Mark301 on June 14, 2022, 06:54:21 AM...How long do you think the market will take to recover?Even when the cryptocurrency market reaches the bottom, there will be no rapid reversal and growth. There must be a phase of accumulation when the big players will slowly gain a position so that there is no pump. But in any case, we should not stand aside and in the event of a continuing fall, gradually buy the coins are interested in in parts.

comments.author: YOSHIE
comments.body: Quote from: Mark301 on June 14, 2022, 06:54:21 AMHow long do you think the market will take to recover?A phenomenon like this, has happened in the previous year, the crypto market skyrocketed and the market was in free fall, an experience that I often see occurs after the halving occurs, if you have been familiar with the crypto market for a long time, things like this are no stranger to crypto users in general, only those who know about the current phenomenon take the opportunity to buy and sell when the Bull market happens again.Your question, as far as I know no one knows when the market will recover, if anyone knows the prediction, maybe you can look it up on google, but predictions can be right or wrong.now back to the crypto users themselves, how sure they are in one year two years or three years, the answer lies in yourself.

comments.author: sheenshane
comments.body: Quote from: Mark301 on June 14, 2022, 06:54:21 AMWhat will happen next?How long do you think the market will take to recover?We're all looking to it and while seeking this answer I've lately realized that the market is unpredictable and no one really knows it. There's no time frame when the market price will recover and raise again, but this isn't new in the crypto market or in Bitcoin price, if you remember after the bull run in the year 2017 and in the following last quarter of the year, from $20k it dropped to $3k.  It seems it repeats itself and it looks like it will drop from the previous ATH in 2017 and then maybe will create a massive hype after this, we should always prepare instead of worrying. Bitcoin has matured and it's already mainstream and also gained already a mass adoption, I think that's enough evidence for you to have faith in Bitcoin to invest and hold it for a long period of time. Quote from: Mark301 on June 14, 2022, 06:54:21 AMIs it better to wait for a further drop in Bitcoin and Ethereum, or would DCA be better?In Bitcoin for sure DCA way of buying Bitcoin is a wise idea but in Ethereum, I don't know if that is also good.

comments.author: cabron
comments.body: It will still take months to a year like last two bear market I've seen in the past. Seem nothing had changed, the supercycle is a lie kinda like giving a newbie false hope. Since the price fell down to 20k, the market will keep retracing this support line for weeks and if unsucessful for probably a month or 2, this could  mean a gradual bounce. Not an investment advice though.

comments.author: danherbias07
comments.body: The kind of question that had been asked here many times whenever the Bitcoin price drops. Why is it the number of threads created from a dump is higher than the number of threads created when a pump happens and an ATH? Kind of amazing and sad.   But that's a question for a different section. Anyway, I am just using history as means to identify when Bitcoin could recover. From December 2017 pump to 19.5k it recovered July of 2019 but that's only 11k. So don't expect a pump in a hurry, may not be a sharp one too, the recovery may happen a bit longer, time to just chill around and try to accumulate more Bitcoin.

comments.author: jossiel
comments.body: Do DCA.It has always been one of the best thing to do when we're down. You'll see how it's worth it to DCA when we're up again. Those little accumulations that you've done in the past.They're going to be in effect when we're in bull once again. comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: It's pretty normal to see this price drop for Bitcoin and altcoin if you know the history of Bitcoin since before you will notice the cycle.Every block halving is a good start to invest so 2024 would be the best time for me to invest again and hold for the long term. Just like what happened before 2016 and 2017 and now 2020 and 2021 have you noticed the cycle? As you can see there is no difference in the market movement around that time? There might be a slight difference but they are the same as how the bull market comes after block-halving.

comments.author: Oceat
comments.body: It will take a little longer for it to recover so why not buy the dip instead of watching and waiting for it to pump like you saw on bull market. Besides, it's a good thing to have a dip it helps to remove unnecessary traders/investors who only think for a quick profit. You know it's a good thing to have some dip/correction to know who's the real trader and investors that has a strong hand to hold instead of the one shaken when the market starts to drop. Buy every dip that you see and stop thinking when to sell when we are still in bear market.
